alert.note: Alert for Swisher (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Lubbock (Lubbock and South Plains Texas)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 21 at 7:31AM CDT until further notice by NWS Lubbock
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 AM CDT THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Hale, Lamb, Castro and Swisher Counties. * WHEN...Until 900 AM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 727 AM CDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated light to moderate rain continuing over the area. Minor flooding is likely occurring in the advisory area and will continue early this morning. Between 3 and 5 inches of rain fell overnight. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 0.5 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will prolong minor flooding issues. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Olton, Hart, Cotton Center, Halfway, Edmonson and Springlake. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Be aware of swollen playa lakes and water covering roadways. Do not drive through flooded roads.
